table:columns.name: hzname
table:columns.description: The full horizon designation, such as Ap, E, or 2Bt2, is shown in this column.  Individual parts of the horizon designation (discontinuity, master horizon, suffixes) are in separate columns. The concatenated string of the individual parts used to distinguish different kinds of layers in the soil.  (Soil Survey Manual)

table:columns.name: desgndisc
table:columns.description: An Arabic numeral used to indicate a significant change in particle-size distribution or mineralogy that indicates a difference in the material from which the horizon(s) formed and/or a significant difference in age, unless that difference in age is indicated by the suffix "b".  This numeral is one of four kinds of symbols, that when concatenated, are used to distinguish different kinds of layers in the soil. (Soil Survey Manual)

table:columns.name: desgnmaster
table:columns.description: One of four kinds of symbols, that when concatenated, are used to distinguish different kinds of layers in soils.  Master horizons and layers are the base symbols to which other characters are added to complete the designations.  Capital letters, virgules (/), the word 'and', and carets (^) are used.   (Soil Survey Manual)

table:columns.name: desgnmasterprime
table:columns.description: A character used to indicate that this horizon has an identical horizon designation as some overlying horizon.  The two horizons in question are separated by at least one other horizon.

table:columns.name: desgnvert
table:columns.description: One of the four kinds of symbols, when concatenated, are used to distinguish different kinds of layers in soils. Vertical subdivisions are used to subdivide a horizon or layer designated by a single letter or combination of letters.

table:columns.name: hzdept_l
table:columns.description: The distance from the top of the soil to the upper boundary of the soil horizon.

table:columns.name: hzdept_r
table:columns.description: The distance from the top of the soil to the upper boundary of the soil horizon.

table:columns.name: hzdept_h
table:columns.description: The distance from the top of the soil to the upper boundary of the soil horizon.

table:columns.name: hzdepb_l
table:columns.description: The distance from the top of the soil to the base of the soil horizon.

table:columns.name: hzdepb_r
table:columns.description: The distance from the top of the soil to the base of the soil horizon.

table:columns.name: hzdepb_h
table:columns.description: The distance from the top of the soil to the base of the soil horizon.

table:columns.name: hzthk_l
table:columns.description: A measurement from the top to bottom of a soil horizon throughout its areal extent.

table:columns.name: hzthk_r
table:columns.description: A measurement from the top to bottom of a soil horizon throughout its areal extent.

table:columns.name: hzthk_h
table:columns.description: A measurement from the top to bottom of a soil horizon throughout its areal extent.

table:columns.name: fraggt10_l
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of the horizon occupied by rock fragments greater than 10 inches in size.

table:columns.name: fraggt10_r
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of the horizon occupied by rock fragments greater than 10 inches in size.

table:columns.name: fraggt10_h
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of the horizon occupied by rock fragments greater than 10 inches in size.

table:columns.name: frag3to10_l
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of the horizon occupied by rock fragments 3 to 10 inches in size.

table:columns.name: frag3to10_r
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of the horizon occupied by rock fragments 3 to 10 inches in size.

table:columns.name: frag3to10_h
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of the horizon occupied by rock fragments 3 to 10 inches in size.

table:columns.name: sieveno4_l
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 4 sieve (4.70mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno4_r
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 4 sieve (4.70mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno4_h
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 4 sieve (4.70mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno10_l
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 10 sieve (2.00mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno10_r
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 10 sieve (2.00mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno10_h
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 10 sieve (2.00mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno40_l
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 40 sieve (0.42mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno40_r
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 40 sieve (0.42mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno40_h
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 40 sieve (0.42mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno200_l
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 200 sieve (0.074mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno200_r
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 200 sieve (0.074mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sieveno200_h
table:columns.description: Soil fraction passing a number 200 sieve (0.074mm square opening) as a weight percentage of the less than 3 inch (76.4mm) fraction.

table:columns.name: sandtotal_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.05mm to 2.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandtotal_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.05mm to 2.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandtotal_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.05mm to 2.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandvc_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 1.0mm to 2.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandvc_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 1.0mm to 2.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandvc_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 1.0mm to 2.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandco_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.5mm to 1.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandco_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.5mm to 1.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandco_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.5mm to 1.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandmed_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.25mm to 0.5mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandmed_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.25mm to 0.5mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandmed_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.25mm to 0.5mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandfine_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.10 to 0.25mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandfine_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.10 to 0.25mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandfine_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.10 to 0.25mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandvf_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.05 to 0.10mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandvf_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.05 to 0.10mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: sandvf_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.05 to 0.10mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction.

table:columns.name: silttotal_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.002 to 0.05mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: silttotal_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.002 to 0.05mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: silttotal_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles 0.002 to 0.05mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: siltco_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles ranging in size from 0.02mm to 0.05mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: siltco_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles ranging in size from 0.02mm to 0.05mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: siltco_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles ranging in size from 0.02mm to 0.05mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: siltfine_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles ranging in size from 0.002 to 0.02mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: siltfine_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles ranging in size from 0.002 to 0.02mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: siltfine_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles ranging in size from 0.002 to 0.02mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: claytotal_l
table:columns.description: Mineral particles less than 0.002mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: claytotal_r
table:columns.description: Mineral particles less than 0.002mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: claytotal_h
table:columns.description: Mineral particles less than 0.002mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: claysizedcarb_l
table:columns.description: Carbonate particles less than 0.002mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: claysizedcarb_r
table:columns.description: Carbonate particles less than 0.002mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: claysizedcarb_h
table:columns.description: Carbonate particles less than 0.002mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

table:columns.name: om_l
table:columns.description: The amount by weight of decomposed plant and animal residue expressed as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm soil material.

table:columns.name: om_r
table:columns.description: The amount by weight of decomposed plant and animal residue expressed as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm soil material.

table:columns.name: om_h
table:columns.description: The amount by weight of decomposed plant and animal residue expressed as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm soil material.

table:columns.name: dbtenthbar_l
table:columns.description: The oven dried weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 1/10 bar.

table:columns.name: dbtenthbar_r
table:columns.description: The oven dried weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 1/10 bar.

table:columns.name: dbtenthbar_h
table:columns.description: The oven dried weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 1/10 bar.

table:columns.name: dbthirdbar_l
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 1/3 bar.

table:columns.name: dbthirdbar_r
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 1/3 bar.

table:columns.name: dbthirdbar_h
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 1/3 bar.

table:columns.name: dbfifteenbar_l
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 15 bar.

table:columns.name: dbfifteenbar_r
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 15 bar.

table:columns.name: dbfifteenbar_h
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil at a water tension of 15 bar.

table:columns.name: dbovendry_l
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil exclusive of the desiccation cracks, measured on a coated clod.

table:columns.name: dbovendry_r
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil exclusive of the desiccation cracks, measured on a coated clod.

table:columns.name: dbovendry_h
table:columns.description: The oven dry weight of the less than 2 mm soil material per unit volume of soil exclusive of the desiccation cracks, measured on a coated clod.

table:columns.name: partdensity
table:columns.description: Mass per unit of volume (not including pore space) of the solid soil particle either mineral or organic.  Also known as specific gravity.

table:columns.name: ksat_l
table:columns.description: The amount of water that would move vertically through a unit area of saturated soil in unit time under unit hydraulic gradient.

table:columns.name: ksat_r
table:columns.description: The amount of water that would move vertically through a unit area of saturated soil in unit time under unit hydraulic gradient.

table:columns.name: ksat_h
table:columns.description: The amount of water that would move vertically through a unit area of saturated soil in unit time under unit hydraulic gradient.

table:columns.name: awc_l
table:columns.description: The amount of water that an increment of soil depth, inclusive of fragments, can store that is available to plants.  AWC is expressed as a volume fraction, and is commonly estimated as the difference between the water contents at 1/10 or 1/3 bar (field capacity) and 15 bars (permanent wilting point) tension and adjusted for salinity, and fragments.

table:columns.name: awc_r
table:columns.description: The amount of water that an increment of soil depth, inclusive of fragments, can store that is available to plants.  AWC is expressed as a volume fraction, and is commonly estimated as the difference between the water contents at 1/10 or 1/3 bar (field capacity) and 15 bars (permanent wilting point) tension and adjusted for salinity, and fragments.

table:columns.name: awc_h
table:columns.description: The amount of water that an increment of soil depth, inclusive of fragments, can store that is available to plants.  AWC is expressed as a volume fraction, and is commonly estimated as the difference between the water contents at 1/10 or 1/3 bar (field capacity) and 15 bars (permanent wilting point) tension and adjusted for salinity, and fragments.

table:columns.name: wtenthbar_l
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 1/10 bar (10 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wtenthbar_r
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 1/10 bar (10 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wtenthbar_h
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 1/10 bar (10 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wthirdbar_l
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 1/3 bar (33 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wthirdbar_r
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 1/3 bar (33 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wthirdbar_h
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 1/3 bar (33 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wfifteenbar_l
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 15 bars (1500 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wfifteenbar_r
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 15 bars (1500 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wfifteenbar_h
table:columns.description: The volumetric content of soil water retained at a tension of 15 bars (1500 kPa), expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wsatiated_l
table:columns.description: The estimated volumetric soil water content at or near zero bar tension, expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wsatiated_r
table:columns.description: The estimated volumetric soil water content at or near zero bar tension, expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: wsatiated_h
table:columns.description: The estimated volumetric soil water content at or near zero bar tension, expressed as a percentage of the whole soil.

table:columns.name: lep_l
table:columns.description: The linear expression of the volume difference of natural soil fabric at 1/3 or 1/10 bar water content and oven dryness. The volume change is reported as percent change for the whole soil.

table:columns.name: lep_r
table:columns.description: The linear expression of the volume difference of natural soil fabric at 1/3 or 1/10 bar water content and oven dryness. The volume change is reported as percent change for the whole soil.

table:columns.name: lep_h
table:columns.description: The linear expression of the volume difference of natural soil fabric at 1/3 or 1/10 bar water content and oven dryness. The volume change is reported as percent change for the whole soil.

table:columns.name: ll_l
table:columns.description: The water content of the soil at the change between the liquid and plastic states. Values less than 14 cannot be measured and are assigned a zero in the database.  The zero indicates a non-plastic soil.

table:columns.name: ll_r
table:columns.description: The water content of the soil at the change between the liquid and plastic states. Values less than 14 cannot be measured and are assigned a zero in the database.  The zero indicates a non-plastic soil.

table:columns.name: ll_h
table:columns.description: The water content of the soil at the change between the liquid and plastic states. Values less than 14 cannot be measured and are assigned a zero in the database.  The zero indicates a non-plastic soil.

table:columns.name: pi_l
table:columns.description: The numerical difference between the liquid limit and plastic limit.

table:columns.name: pi_r
table:columns.description: The numerical difference between the liquid limit and plastic limit.

table:columns.name: pi_h
table:columns.description: The numerical difference between the liquid limit and plastic limit.

table:columns.name: aashind_l
table:columns.description: The empirical group index formula devised for approximately within-group evaluation of the "clayey granular materials" and the "silty-clay materials".

table:columns.name: aashind_r
table:columns.description: The empirical group index formula devised for approximately within-group evaluation of the "clayey granular materials" and the "silty-clay materials".

table:columns.name: aashind_h
table:columns.description: The empirical group index formula devised for approximately within-group evaluation of the "clayey granular materials" and the "silty-clay materials".

table:columns.name: kwfact
table:columns.description: The ease with which pores of a saturated soil transmit water. Formally, the proportionality coefficient that expresses the relationship of the rate of water movement to hydraulic gradient in Darcy's Law, a law that describes the rate of water movement through porous media. Commonly abbreviated as "Ksat".   Expressed micrometers per second. To convert micrometers per second to inches per hour, multiply micrometers per second by 0.1417.

table:columns.name: kffact
table:columns.description: An erodibility factor which quantifies the susceptibility of soil particles to detachment by water for the fine earth portion of the soil (excludes rock fragments) expressed in ton.acre.hr (hundreds of acre.foot.tonf.inch)-1.

table:columns.name: caco3_l
table:columns.description: The quantity of Carbonate (CO3) in the soil expressed as CaCO3 and as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm size fraction.

table:columns.name: caco3_r
table:columns.description: The quantity of Carbonate (CO3) in the soil expressed as CaCO3 and as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm size fraction.

table:columns.name: caco3_h
table:columns.description: The quantity of Carbonate (CO3) in the soil expressed as CaCO3 and as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm size fraction.

table:columns.name: gypsum_l
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of hydrated calcium sulfate in the less than 20 mm fraction of soil.

table:columns.name: gypsum_r
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of hydrated calcium sulfate in the less than 20 mm fraction of soil.

table:columns.name: gypsum_h
table:columns.description: The percent by weight of hydrated calcium sulfate in the less than 20 mm fraction of soil.

table:columns.name: sar_l
table:columns.description: A measure of the amount of Sodium (Na) relative to Calcium (Ca) and Magnesium (Mg) in the water extract from saturated soil paste. (Soil Survey Staff (2004, method 4F3b)

table:columns.name: sar_r
table:columns.description: A measure of the amount of Sodium (Na) relative to Calcium (Ca) and Magnesium (Mg) in the water extract from saturated soil paste. (Soil Survey Staff (2004, method 4F3b)

table:columns.name: sar_h
table:columns.description: A measure of the amount of Sodium (Na) relative to Calcium (Ca) and Magnesium (Mg) in the water extract from saturated soil paste. (Soil Survey Staff (2004, method 4F3b)

table:columns.name: ec_l
table:columns.description: The electrical conductivity of an extract from saturated soil paste.

table:columns.name: ec_r
table:columns.description: The electrical conductivity of an extract from saturated soil paste.

table:columns.name: ec_h
table:columns.description: The electrical conductivity of an extract from saturated soil paste.

table:columns.name: cec7_l
table:columns.description: The amount of readily exchangeable cations that can be electrically adsorbed to negative charges in the soil, soil constituent, or other material, at pH 7.0, as estimated by the ammonium acetate method.

table:columns.name: cec7_r
table:columns.description: The amount of readily exchangeable cations that can be electrically adsorbed to negative charges in the soil, soil constituent, or other material, at pH 7.0, as estimated by the ammonium acetate method.

table:columns.name: cec7_h
table:columns.description: The amount of readily exchangeable cations that can be electrically adsorbed to negative charges in the soil, soil constituent, or other material, at pH 7.0, as estimated by the ammonium acetate method.

table:columns.name: ecec_l
table:columns.description: The sum of NH4OAc extractable bases plus KCl extractable aluminum.

table:columns.name: ecec_r
table:columns.description: The sum of NH4OAc extractable bases plus KCl extractable aluminum.

table:columns.name: ecec_h
table:columns.description: The sum of NH4OAc extractable bases plus KCl extractable aluminum.

table:columns.name: sumbases_l
table:columns.description: The sum of NH4OAc extractable bases (pH 7.0), reported on less than 2mm base.

table:columns.name: sumbases_r
table:columns.description: The sum of NH4OAc extractable bases (pH 7.0), reported on less than 2mm base.

table:columns.name: sumbases_h
table:columns.description: The sum of NH4OAc extractable bases (pH 7.0), reported on less than 2mm base.

table:columns.name: ph1to1h2o_l
table:columns.description: The negative common logarithm of the hydrogen ion activity in the soil using the 1:1 soil-water ratio method.  A numerical expression of the relative acidity or alkalinity of a soil sample.  (SSM)

table:columns.name: ph1to1h2o_r
table:columns.description: The negative common logarithm of the hydrogen ion activity in the soil using the 1:1 soil-water ratio method.  A numerical expression of the relative acidity or alkalinity of a soil sample.  (SSM)

table:columns.name: ph1to1h2o_h
table:columns.description: The negative common logarithm of the hydrogen ion activity in the soil using the 1:1 soil-water ratio method.  A numerical expression of the relative acidity or alkalinity of a soil sample.  (SSM)

table:columns.name: ph01mcacl2_l
table:columns.description: The negative common logarithm of the hydrogen ion activity in the soil, using the 0.01M CaCl2 method, in a 1:2 soil:solution ratio.  A numerical expression of the relative acidity or alkalinity of a soil sample. (SSM)

table:columns.name: ph01mcacl2_r
table:columns.description: The negative common logarithm of the hydrogen ion activity in the soil, using the 0.01M CaCl2 method, in a 1:2 soil:solution ratio.  A numerical expression of the relative acidity or alkalinity of a soil sample. (SSM)

table:columns.name: ph01mcacl2_h
table:columns.description: The negative common logarithm of the hydrogen ion activity in the soil, using the 0.01M CaCl2 method, in a 1:2 soil:solution ratio.  A numerical expression of the relative acidity or alkalinity of a soil sample. (SSM)

table:columns.name: freeiron_l
table:columns.description: The secondary iron oxides such as geothite, hematite, ferrihydrite, lepidocrocite and maghemite.  This form of iron may occur as discrete particles, as coatings on other particles, or as cementing agents between soil mineral grains.  It is iron extracted by dithionite-citrate.

table:columns.name: freeiron_r
table:columns.description: The secondary iron oxides such as geothite, hematite, ferrihydrite, lepidocrocite and maghemite.  This form of iron may occur as discrete particles, as coatings on other particles, or as cementing agents between soil mineral grains.  It is iron extracted by dithionite-citrate.

table:columns.name: freeiron_h
table:columns.description: The secondary iron oxides such as geothite, hematite, ferrihydrite, lepidocrocite and maghemite.  This form of iron may occur as discrete particles, as coatings on other particles, or as cementing agents between soil mineral grains.  It is iron extracted by dithionite-citrate.

table:columns.name: feoxalate_l
table:columns.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable iron in the less than 2mm fraction.  It is considered a measure of noncrystalline iron in the soil.

table:columns.name: feoxalate_r
table:columns.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable iron in the less than 2mm fraction.  It is considered a measure of noncrystalline iron in the soil.

table:columns.name: feoxalate_h
table:columns.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable iron in the less than 2mm fraction.  It is considered a measure of noncrystalline iron in the soil.

table:columns.name: extracid_l
table:columns.description: A measure of soil exchangeable hydrogen ions that may become active by cation exchange.

table:columns.name: extracid_r
table:columns.description: A measure of soil exchangeable hydrogen ions that may become active by cation exchange.

table:columns.name: extracid_h
table:columns.description: A measure of soil exchangeable hydrogen ions that may become active by cation exchange.

table:columns.name: extral_l
table:columns.description: The amount of aluminum extracted in 1 normal potassium chloride.  The following laboratory method is applied:  55 ml of 1 normal potassium chloride is extracted through 2.5 g of soil sample.  The extract is analyzed by use of an atomic adsorption spectrometer or similar instrument (SSIR #1, method 6G9a and NSSH).

table:columns.name: extral_r
table:columns.description: The amount of aluminum extracted in 1 normal potassium chloride.  The following laboratory method is applied:  55 ml of 1 normal potassium chloride is extracted through 2.5 g of soil sample.  The extract is analyzed by use of an atomic adsorption spectrometer or similar instrument (SSIR #1, method 6G9a and NSSH).

table:columns.name: extral_h
table:columns.description: The amount of aluminum extracted in 1 normal potassium chloride.  The following laboratory method is applied:  55 ml of 1 normal potassium chloride is extracted through 2.5 g of soil sample.  The extract is analyzed by use of an atomic adsorption spectrometer or similar instrument (SSIR #1, method 6G9a and NSSH).

table:columns.name: aloxalate_l
table:columns.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable aluminum in the less than 2mm fraction.  This is an estimate of the total pedogenic aluminum, much of which may be in noncrystalline material, or complexed by organic matter.

table:columns.name: aloxalate_r
table:columns.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable aluminum in the less than 2mm fraction.  This is an estimate of the total pedogenic aluminum, much of which may be in noncrystalline material, or complexed by organic matter.

table:columns.name: aloxalate_h
table:columns.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable aluminum in the less than 2mm fraction.  This is an estimate of the total pedogenic aluminum, much of which may be in noncrystalline material, or complexed by organic matter.

table:columns.name: pbray1_l
table:columns.description: The amount of phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable using the Bray1 method.  It represents the plant available phosphorous content.

table:columns.name: pbray1_r
table:columns.description: The amount of phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable using the Bray1 method.  It represents the plant available phosphorous content.

table:columns.name: pbray1_h
table:columns.description: The amount of phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable using the Bray1 method.  It represents the plant available phosphorous content.

table:columns.name: poxalate_l
table:columns.description: The amount of phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable by ammonium oxalate method.  It represents the phosphorous level intermediate between total P and water soluble P.

table:columns.name: poxalate_r
table:columns.description: The amount of phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable by ammonium oxalate method.  It represents the phosphorous level intermediate between total P and water soluble P.

table:columns.name: poxalate_h
table:columns.description: The amount of phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable by ammonium oxalate method.  It represents the phosphorous level intermediate between total P and water soluble P.

table:columns.name: ph2osoluble_l
table:columns.description: The amount of water soluble phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable by distilled water.  It represents the mobile phosphorous content.

table:columns.name: ph2osoluble_r
table:columns.description: The amount of water soluble phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable by distilled water.  It represents the mobile phosphorous content.

table:columns.name: ph2osoluble_h
table:columns.description: The amount of water soluble phosphorous in the less than 2mm fraction, that is extractable by distilled water.  It represents the mobile phosphorous content.

table:columns.name: ptotal_l
table:columns.description: The estimate of the total phosphorous content of the soil, measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of the soil material.  It is reported as a gravimetric percent oxide of the size fraction used.

table:columns.name: ptotal_r
table:columns.description: The estimate of the total phosphorous content of the soil, measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of the soil material.  It is reported as a gravimetric percent oxide of the size fraction used.

table:columns.name: ptotal_h
table:columns.description: The estimate of the total phosphorous content of the soil, measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of the soil material.  It is reported as a gravimetric percent oxide of the size fraction used.

table:columns.name: excavdifcl
table:columns.description: An estimation of the difficulty of working an excavation into soil layers, horizons, pedons, or geologic layers.  In most instances, excavation difficulty is related to and controlled by a water state.

table:columns.name: excavdifms
table:columns.description: The soil moisture status for which the excavation difficulty class is assigned for the individual component.

table:columns.name: cokey
table:columns.description: The unique identifier of a record in the Component table.  Use this column to join the Horizon table to the Component table.

table:columns.name: chkey
table:columns.description: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Horizon table.
